Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Represents a player in the game.
    Author:
    David Eriksson, Fredrik Lindahl

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(Game game, PlayerType type, java.lang.String name, java.io.InputStream is, java.io.OutputStream os)
      Creates a new player from specified data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(Game game,
              PlayerType type,
              java.lang.String name,
              java.io.InputStream is,
              java.io.OutputStream os)
        Creates a new player from specified data.
        Parameters:
        game - Which game the player is connected to.
        type - The type the player is, pacman or ghost.
        name - The name of the player.
        is - The input stream of the player.
        os - The output stream of the player.

    • Method Detail

      • addUpdate

        public void addUpdate(Player p)
        Adds a new player to this players list of not updated players.
        Parameters:
        p - The player to be updated.

      • changeType

        public void changeType(PlayerType pt)
        Changes the type which the player has.
        Parameters:
        pt - The new playertype the player shall have.

      • getUpdate

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getUpdate()
        Gets the list which players this player hasn't gotten update from.
        Returns:
        An list containing all players which have updated their data.

      • lobbyUpdate

        public void lobbyUpdate(java.lang.String name,
                        boolean joined)
        Sends an update message if someone has joined or left a lobby.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player who has made an action.
        joined - An boolean containing if the player joined or left the lobby.

      • run

        The main thread which waits for input from the user and later sends out corresponding response.
